Game¶

class gamegine.representation.game.Game[source]¶

A class representing an FRC Game. Serves as the base container for all other representation objects such as obstacles, interactables, and zones. Also stores any and all game logic and state variables.

Parameters:

name (str, optional) – The name of the game. Defaults to “FRC Game”.

__init__(name='FRC Game')[source]¶

Constructor method for the Game class. Initializes the game with a name and default field size of 15m x 15m.

Parameters:

name (str)

Return type:

None

add_obstacle(obstacle)[source]¶

Adds an obstacle to the game.

Parameters:

obstacle (Obstacle) – The obstacle to add.

Return type:

Game

Adds a list of obstacles to the game.

Parameters:

obstacles (List[Obstacle]) – The obstacles to add.

Returns:

The game object with the added obstacles.

modify_obstacle(obstacle)[source]¶

Replaces an existing obstacle with a new one, allowing for modifications to the obstacle. If the obstacle does not exist, it will be added.

Parameters:

obstacle (Obstacle) – The obstacle to modify.

Returns:

The game object with the modified obstacle.

Return type:

Game

modify_obstacles(obstacles)[source]¶

Replaces existing obstacles with new ones, allowing for modifications to the obstacles. If an obstacle does not exist, it will be added.

Parameters:

obstacles (List[Obstacle]) – The obstacles to modify.

Returns:

The game object with the modified obstacles.

Return type:

Game

Sets the field size of the game.

Parameters:

  • width (SpatialMeasurement) – The width of the field.

  • height (SpatialMeasurement) – The height of the field.

Bounds¶

class gamegine.representation.bounds.Boundary[source]¶

Abstract base class for representing a boundary of an object. Boundaries are used to represent the shape of an object in 2D space. Boundaries can be translated, scaled, and reflected across the x and y axes. Boundaries can also be discretized into a series of points.

abstract discretized(curve_segments=5)[source]¶

Discretizes the boundary into a series of points.

Parameters:

curve_segments (int) – The number of curve segments to use when discretizing the boundary.

Returns:

The discretized boundary.

Return type:

DiscreteBoundary

Parameters:

Returns:

The reflected boundary.

Return type:

Boundary

class gamegine.representation.bounds.BoundedObject[source]¶

Base class for representing game objects which occupy a space on the field. Contain a boundary which indicates the space the object occupies.

class gamegine.representation.bounds.Circle[source]¶

Class for representing a circle boundary, extending the Boundary class. Circles can be used to represent the shape of an object in 2D space.

Parameters:

  • y (SpatialMeasurement) – The y value of the center of the circle.

  • radius (SpatialMeasurement) – The radius of the circle.

gamegine.representation.bounds.CircularPattern(objects, center, angle, num_objects, prefix_func)[source]¶

Creates a circular pattern of objects around a center point, allowing for a BoundedObject to be rotated and copied around a center point.

Parameters:

  • objects (List[BoundedObject]) – The objects to create a circular pattern of.

  • center (Tuple[SpatialMeasurement, SpatialMeasurement]) – The center point of the circular pattern.

  • angle (AngularMeasurement) – The angle to rotate each object by.

  • num_objects (int) – The number of objects to create in the circular pattern, inclusive of the original objects.

  • prefix_func (Callable[[int], str]) – The function to prefix the name of each object with.

Returns:

The objects in the circular pattern.

Return type:

List[BoundedObject]

class gamegine.representation.bounds.DiscreteBoundary[source]¶

Base class for representing discrete boundaries which can be marked by a series of points, extending the Boundary class. Discrete boundaries can be used to represent the shape of an object in 2D space. Can be used in all the manner of the base class, but also provides methods for checking if the boundary intersects a line, rectangle, or point, and for getting the bounded rectangle of the boundary.

buffered(distance)[source]¶

Returns a buffered version of the boundary, providing a certain amount of padding around the boundary. Used to indicate safe areas which account for object sizes.

Parameters:

distance (SpatialMeasurement) – The distance to buffer the boundary by.

Returns:

The buffered boundary.

Return type:

DiscreteBoundary

contains_point(x, y)[source]¶

Checks if the boundary contains a point.

Parameters:

  • x (SpatialMeasurement) – The x value of the point.

  • y (SpatialMeasurement) – The y value of the point.

Returns:

True if the boundary contains the point, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

discretized(curve_segments=5)[source]¶

Discretizes the boundary into a series of points.

Parameters:

curve_segments (int) – The number of curve segments to use when discretizing the boundary.

Returns:

The discretized boundary.

Return type:

DiscreteBoundary

draw(render_scale)[source]¶

Draws the boundary, used by the Renderer to draw the boundary.

Parameters:

render_scale (SpatialMeasurement) – The scale to render the boundary at.

Return type:

None

  • z_end (SpatialMeasurement) – The ending z value of the boundary.

intersects_line(x1, y1, x2, y2)[source]¶

Checks if the boundary intersects a line.

Parameters:

  • x1 (SpatialMeasurement) – The x value of the first point of the line.

  • y1 (SpatialMeasurement) – The y value of the first point of the line.

  • x2 (SpatialMeasurement) – The x value of the second point of the line.

  • y2 (SpatialMeasurement) – The y value of the second point of the line.

Returns:

True if the boundary intersects the line, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

intersects_rectangle(x, y, max_x, max_y)[source]¶

Checks if the boundary intersects a rectangle.

Parameters:

  • x (SpatialMeasurement) – The x value of the bottom left corner of the rectangle.

  • y (SpatialMeasurement) – The y value of the bottom left corner of the rectangle.

  • max_x (SpatialMeasurement) – The x value of the top right corner of the rectangle.

  • max_y (SpatialMeasurement) – The y value of the top right corner of the rectangle.

Returns:

True if the boundary intersects the rectangle, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

gamegine.representation.bounds.ExpandedBounds(bounds, robot_radius=21.0 in, discretization_quality=4)[source]¶

Returns the expanded bounds of a list of boundaries, providing a certain amount of padding around the boundaries to account for object sizes.

Parameters:

  • bounds (List[Boundary]) – The boundaries to get the expanded bounds of.

  • robot_radius (SpatialMeasurement) – The radius of the robot to expand the bounds by.

  • discretization_quality (int) – The quality of discretization to use when expanding the bounds.

Returns:

The expanded bounds of the boundaries.

Return type:

List[DiscreteBoundary]

gamegine.representation.bounds.ExpandedObjectBounds(objects, robot_radius=21.0 in, discretization_quality=4)[source]¶

Returns the expanded bounds of a list of objects, providing a certain amount of padding around the objects to account for object sizes.

Parameters:

  • objects (List[BoundedObject]) – The objects to get the expanded bounds of.

  • robot_radius (SpatialMeasurement) – The radius of the robot to expand the bounds by.

  • discretization_quality (int) – The quality of discretization to use when expanding the bounds.

Returns:

The expanded bounds of the objects.

Return type:

List[DiscreteBoundary]

class gamegine.representation.bounds.Line[source]¶

gamegine.representation.bounds.LineIntersectsAnyBound(bounds, x1, y1, x2, y2)[source]¶

Checks if a line intersects any of the given boundaries.

Parameters:

  • bounds (List[DiscreteBoundary]) – The boundaries to check for intersection.

  • x1 (SpatialMeasurement) – The x value of the first point of the line.

  • y1 (SpatialMeasurement) – The y value of the first point of the line.

  • x2 (SpatialMeasurement) – The x value of the second point of the line.

  • y2 (SpatialMeasurement) – The y value of the second point of the line.

Returns:

Return type:

bool

class gamegine.representation.bounds.Rectangle[source]¶

Class for representing a rectangle boundary, extending the DiscreteBoundary class. Rectangles can be used to represent the shape of an object in 2D space. Includes additional methods for getting the minimum and maximum x and y values of the rectangle.

Parameters:

  • x (SpatialMeasurement) – The x value of the bottom left corner of the rectangle.

  • y (SpatialMeasurement) – The y value of the bottom left corner of the rectangle.

  • width (SpatialMeasurement) – The width of the rectangle.

  • height (SpatialMeasurement) – The height of the rectangle.

__init__(x, y, width, height)[source]¶
Parameters:

  • x (SpatialMeasurement)

  • y (SpatialMeasurement)

  • width (SpatialMeasurement)

  • height (SpatialMeasurement)

Parameters:

curve_segments (int) – The number of curve segments to use when discretizing the boundary.

Returns:

The discretized boundary.

Return type:

DiscreteBoundary

get_3d(z_start=0.0 ft, z_end=0.0 ft)[source]¶

Returns the 3D version of the boundary.

Parameters:

  • z_start (SpatialMeasurement) – The starting z value of the boundary.

  • z_end (SpatialMeasurement) – The ending z value of the boundary.

Returns:

The 3D version of the boundary.

Return type:

DiscreteBoundary3D

get_center()[source]¶

Returns the center of the rectangle.

Returns:

The center of the rectangle.

Return type:

get_max_x()[source]¶

Returns the maximum x value of the rectangle, being the x value of the right side of the rectangle.

SpatialMeasurement

get_max_y()[source]¶

Return type:

SpatialMeasurement

gamegine.representation.bounds.SymmetricalX(objects, axis, prefix, prefix_og='')[source]¶

Creates a symmetrical pattern of objects across the x-axis at the given axis, copying the objects and mirroring them across the axis.

Parameters:

  • objects (List[BoundedObject]) – The objects to create a symmetrical pattern of.

  • axis (SpatialMeasurement) – The axis to create the symmetrical pattern across, x = axis will be the axis of symmetry.

  • prefix (str) – The prefix to add to the name of each object.

  • prefix_og (str) – The prefix to add to the name of the original objects.

Returns:

The objects in the symmetrical pattern.

Return type:

List[BoundedObject]

gamegine.representation.bounds.SymmetricalXY(objects, axis_x, axis_y, prefix, prefix_og='')[source]¶

Creates a symmetrical pattern of objects across both the x and y axes at the given axes, copying the objects and mirroring them across the axes.

Parameters:

  • objects (List[BoundedObject]) – The objects to create a symmetrical pattern of.

  • axis_x (SpatialMeasurement) – The x-axis to create the symmetrical pattern across, x = axis will be the axis of symmetry.

  • axis_y (SpatialMeasurement) – The y-axis to create the symmetrical pattern across, y = axis will be the axis of symmetry.

  • prefix (str) – The prefix to add to the name of each object.

  • prefix_og (str) – The prefix to add to the name of the original objects.

Returns:

The objects in the symmetrical pattern.

Return type:

List[BoundedObject]

gamegine.representation.bounds.SymmetricalY(objects, axis, prefix, prefix_og='')[source]¶

Creates a symmetrical pattern of objects across the y-axis at the given axis, copying the objects and mirroring them across the axis.

Parameters:

  • objects (List[BoundedObject]) – The objects to create a symmetrical pattern of.

  • axis (SpatialMeasurement) – The axis to create the symmetrical pattern across, y = axis will be the axis of symmetry.

  • prefix (str) – The prefix to add to the name of each object.

  • prefix_og (str) – The prefix to add to the name of the original objects.

Returns:

The objects in the symmetrical pattern.

Return type:

List[BoundedObject]

class gamegine.representation.interactable.InteractionOption[source]¶

Class for representing an interaction option for a robot with an interactable object during the match.

  • description (str) – A description of the interaction option.

  • condition (Callable[[StateSpace, RobotState, StateSpace], bool]) – A function which determines whether the interaction can be performed.

  • action (Callable[[StateSpace, RobotState, StateSpace], List[ValueChange]]) – A function which performs the interaction and returns the changes to the game state.

Determines whether the interaction can be performed.

Parameters:

  • interactableState (StateSpace) – The state space of the interactable object.

  • robotState (RobotState) – The state of the robot.

  • gameState (StateSpace) – The state space of the game.

Returns:

Return type:

bool

Performs the interaction and returns the changes to the game state.

Parameters:

  • interactableState (StateSpace) – The state space of the interactable object.

  • robotState (RobotState) – The state of the robot.

  • gameState (StateSpace) – The state space of the game.
